description: {"blocks":[{"key":"3htom","text":"This protocol was designed for use in Beta vulgaris and Beta crop wild relatives. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":38,"length":14},{"style":"italic","offset":56,"length":4}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"dp3lt","text":"It uses several types of software and the online platform, GenSAS for assembly and annotation. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"bvh34","text":"Data input sequencing types are HiFi, Iso-Seq and Omni-C with HiRise scaffolding.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"78vmk","text":"The tissue collection protocol is available by searching the author profiles for \"Sugar Beet Tissue Collection for Genome Assembly and Annotation with Long Read Sequencing\".","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1mg4f","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"92g1g","text":"This protocol is split into three pre-processing sections, as each input sequencing type requires some pre-processing. The fourth section uses generated input files from the preprocessing steps and explains where the file will be used and in which step. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

fork_info.title: Genome Assembly, Scaffolding, and Annotation Pipeline in Sugar Beet

keywords: Long read sequencing, genomics, de novo assembly, FC309, sugar beet genome
manuscript_citation: {"blocks":[{"key":"kin","text":"If this protocol is helpful to you, look out for the published paper to cite!","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3gu81","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"96tjj","text":"Here is the pre-print:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5tvcb","text":"https://www.biorxiv.org/content/10.1101/2024.05.04.592522v1.abstract","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":68}],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"link","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"EDC80F001D1111EFB24D0A58A9FEAC02","url":"https://www.biorxiv.org/content/10.1101/2024.05.04.592522v1.abstract"}}}}

status.info: We use this protocol and it's working

steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"8mda2","text":"This protocol uses the file name \"FC309\" as the base name of the population being sequenced. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"8hsti","text":"The computational steps are completed using USDA-ARS's High Performance Computing Platform, Ceres.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"icvh","text":"Use the following page as a guideline for the isoseq processing: https://isoseq.how/clustering/cli-workflow.html","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":65,"length":47}],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"link","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"51E7E996B94C11EE8BB10A58A9FEAC02","url":"https://isoseq.how/clustering/cli-workflow.html"}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"8rd62","text":"After logging in to the directory of choice, load the following modules or set up a conda virtual environment with the following software:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"d7ekf","text":"isoseq (v4.0.0)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9hj5h","text":"lima (v2.9.0)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"81mml","text":"BBMap (v39.01)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7qupg","text":"hifiasm (v0.16.0)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ft3io","text":"pbmm2 (v1.11.99)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9q6a5","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"203nj","text":"Alternatively, if you're a scinet user, you can activate a conda environment that contains this software using: ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"69kja","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"98mu","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"8kbho","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"code_insert","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"77n81","text":"source activate /home/olivia.todd/.conda/envs/annotate_env","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"dafu4","text":"Starting with the recommended step 1 (Lima), run:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2ip9p","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"b690b","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"5k8b2","text":" Where hifi.FC309.bam  is the input file, and FC309_isoseq.bam is the base file name for the output file that will be used in step 6. The primers.fasta file is described on the isoseq workflow page.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":7,"length":15},{"style":"bold","offset":46,"length":17},{"style":"bold","offset":138,"length":14},{"style":"italic","offset":21,"length":1},{"style":"italic","offset":151,"length":1}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"code_insert","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"9r7e","text":"lima hifi.FC309.bam primers.fasta FC309_isoseq.bam --isoseq --peek-guess","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"9aqnr","text":"Run isoseq refine using:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"b86na","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"51ga4","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"171ma","text":"Where FC309_isoseq.NEB_5p--NEB_Clontech_3p.bam is output from step 5, and input for step 6. FC309.isoseq.flnc.bam is the new output file. The other options are included, recommended by the documentation. This is the last pre-processing step before aligning the output to each haplome. First, we need to assemble the haplomes using the following steps.  ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":6,"length":41},{"style":"bold","offset":92,"length":22}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"code_insert","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"7hsei","text":"isoseq refine FC309_isoseq.NEB_5p--NEB_Clontech_3p.bam primers.fasta","type":"unstyled"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"cuvoh","text":"FC309.isoseq.flnc.bam --min-rq 0.9 --require-polya","type":"unstyled"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"ajed6","text":"","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"bq0p1","text":"After receiving HiFi reads, filter out adapters using HiFiAdapterFilt: https://github.com/sheinasim/HiFiAdapterFilt","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":71,"length":44}],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"link","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"B8DC015CF8EA11EE99240A58A9FEAC02","url":"https://github.com/sheinasim/HiFiAdapterFilt"}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"6su6i","text":"Here we describe our  pipline for annotation of the two haplomes using GenSAS. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"136h7","text":"https://www.gensas.org/","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":23}],"data":{}},{"key":"fg6iq","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"link","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"235C2F47F90E11EE99240A58A9FEAC02","url":"https://www.gensas.org/user?destination=/gensas"}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"7eqm0","text":"Start a new project for haplome 1 after creating a username and password at https://www.gensas.org/ with appropriate metadata. The analysis for haplome 1 and 2 will be the same, but have two separate project files.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":76,"length":23}],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"link","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"235C2F47F90E11EE99240A58A9FEAC02","url":"https://www.gensas.org/user?destination=/gensas"}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"cl6rp","text":"Under the \"Sequences\" tab, upload the scaffolded haplome file, FC309v1.1.0.fasta that was a result of step 5.3. This file has unanchored contigs that will be annotated along with the 9 scaffolded chromosomes. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":63,"length":18}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"33lhn","text":"Under the \"Repeats\" tab, use the following parameters for the RepeatMasker job:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1k3e4","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"63om7","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"4mag5","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ag89n","text":"*Note:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"fghqj","text":"To generate the FC309v1.1.0-families.fa repeat family fasta file needed for this job, run RepeatModeler according to the steps outlined at https://www.repeatmasker.org/RepeatModeler/. Build a database, then run the main command. Generate a repeat file for each haplome, and upload FC309v1.1.0-families.fa under the \"Evidence\" tab. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":16,"length":24},{"style":"bold","offset":281,"length":23}],"entityRanges":[{"key":1,"offset":139,"length":43}],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"code_insert","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"dc7mi","text":"Search Engine: repeatmasker_engine_sel : ncbi","type":"unstyled"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"dnncd","text":"Speed / Sensitivity: repeatmasker_speed_sel : -q","type":"unstyled"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"57d7c","text":"Repeat Library: FC309v1.1.0-families.fa","type":"unstyled"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"8stel","text":"version : 4.1.1","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}},"1":{"type":"link","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"D3C691730E4111EFA18D0A58A9FEAC02","url":"https://www.repeatmasker.org/RepeatModeler"}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"ccsu5","text":"Upon receiving sequencing data, filter OmniC reads for adapter contamination and low quality bases using BBduk from BBMap with the following code, where DTG_OmniC_792_R1.fastq.gz (*_R1.fastq.gz) and DTG_OmniC_792_R2.fastq.gz are two separate input files: ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":153,"length":26},{"style":"bold","offset":199,"length":26}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2688c","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"egpq8","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"ahga5","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"bscu4","text":"The output files are DTG_OmniC_792_trimmed_R1.fastq.gz and DTG_OmniC_792_trimmed_R2.fastq.gz and are used in section 5, "Haplome assembly and scaffolding". ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":21,"length":33},{"style":"bold","offset":59,"length":34}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"code_insert","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"9350p","text":"for i in *_R1.fastq.gz 
do 
        base=$(basename "$i" _R1.fastq.gz)
        /path/to/software/bbmap/bbduk.sh -Xmx16g \
       in=${base}_R1.fastq.gz \
        in2=${base}_R2.fastq.gz \
        out=${base}_trimmed_R1.fastq \
        out2=${base}_trimmed_R2.fastq \
        ref=~/software/bbmap/resources/adapters.fa \
        k=23 ktrim=r qtrim=rl trimq=20 mink=11
done","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"87uom","text":"Under the \"Masking\" tab, the masked repeat consensus is created with the repeatmasker output from step 7.3","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"9fjg2","text":"Under the \"Align\" tab, run two separate BLASTn jobs with two files from the EL10.2_2 genome release, and the RefBeet-1.2.2 genome release, available on Phytozome:  ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2vthr","text":"1. Bvulgarisssp_vulgaris_782_EL10.2_2.transcript.fa.gz ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":3,"length":52}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1pied","text":"2. GCF_000511025.2_RefBeet-1.2.2_genomic.fasta","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":2,"length":44}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6p3ru","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1or3l","text":"Upload these files under the \"Evidence\" tab. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9kvlo","text":"Run each job with these specific parameters (default):","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7mmhj","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"359n7","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"code_insert","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"es8au","text":"Expect: expect : 1e-50","type":"unstyled"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"4djo7","text":"Max Hits Per Region (culling limit): culling_limit : 5","type":"unstyled"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"90lhq","text":"Word Size: word_size : 11","type":"unstyled"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"d4qak","text":"Gap Open: gapopen : 5","type":"unstyled"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"fjcen","text":"Gap Extend: gapextend : 2","type":"unstyled"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"fajgt","text":"Maximum HSP Distinace: max_hsp_gap : 30000","type":"unstyled"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"17stu","text":"version : 2.12.0","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"5bk4q","text":"Under the \"Structural\" tab, give BRAKER2 the processed IsoSeq file from step 6.1, FC309.isoseq.v1.1.0_aligned.bam. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":82,"length":31}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"dvs8f","text":"Upload this file to the project under the \"Evidence\" tab. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"fe1d7","text":"Assemble filtered HiFi and OmniC reads using hifiasm (https://hifiasm.readthedocs.io/en/latest/index.html). Trimmed and filtered OmniC reads are included from the step 3 \"OmniC pre-processing\" for phasing (--h1 and --h2 flags). ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":54,"length":51}],"data":{}},{"key":"daue3","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4oq4f","text":"FC309.asm is the output file prefix.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":10}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4ugkf","text":"DTG_OmniC_792_trimmed_R1.fastq.gz and DTG_OmniC_792_trimmed_R2.fastq.gz are the OmniC reads. The three remaining fastq.gz files are three runs of HiFi sequencing. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":33},{"style":"bold","offset":38,"length":34},{"style":"bold","offset":113,"length":9}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"glqk","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"244g4","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":1,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"dk04h","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"bbj2m","text":"This process generates output files FC309.asm.hic.hap1.p_ctg.fasta and FC309.asm.hic.hap2.p_ctg.fasta which represent the primary phased OmniC/HiFi integrated assemblies. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":36,"length":31},{"style":"bold","offset":71,"length":31}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"link","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"F024E6FB0E3911EFA18D0A58A9FEAC02","url":"https://hifiasm.readthedocs.io/en/latest/index.html"}},"1":{"type":"code_insert","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"10ls9","text":"hifiasm -o FC309.asm -t76 \\\n--h1 DTG_OmniC_792_trimmed_R1.fastq.gz \\\n--h2 DTG_OmniC_792_trimmed_R2.fastq.gz \\\nFC309_novogene.filt.fastq.gz \\\nFC309_hifi_1.filt.fastq.gz \\\nFC309_hifi_2.filt.fastq.gz","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"ad4vu","text":"The phased, contig level assemblies are run through the NCBI contamination tools \"fcs-adaptor\" and \"fcs-gx\" according to their document pages: https://github.com/ncbi/fcs?tab=readme-ov-file","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":143,"length":46}],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"link","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"66EC64951D2311EFB24D0A58A9FEAC02","url":"https://github.com/ncbi/fcs?tab=readme-ov-file"}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"ed31q","text":"Sort contigs in the FC309.asm.hic.hap1.p_ctg.fasta (haplome 1) and FC309.asm.hic.hap2.p_ctg.fasta (haplome 2) assembly by size (largest to smallest). Rename (ex: USDA_Bvulg_FC309_v0.3_hap1_contig_0000001), then rename the entire assembly file to USDA_Bvulg_FC309_v0.3_hap1.fasta and USDA_Bvulg_FC309_v0.3_hap2.fasta, respectively. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":20,"length":30},{"style":"bold","offset":67,"length":30},{"style":"bold","offset":246,"length":33},{"style":"bold","offset":283,"length":32}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"89ln0","text":"Submit USDA_Bvulg_FC309_v0.3_hap1.fasta and USDA_Bvulg_FC309_v0.3_hap2.fasta to DoveTail for the HiRise scaffoldingÂ process, used to construct pseudochromosomes. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":7,"length":33},{"style":"bold","offset":44,"length":33}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"fjab9","text":"Upon receipt of scaffolded fasta files FC309V1.1.0.fasta (haplome 1) and FC309V1.2.0.fasta (haplome 2), build an index for each fasta using:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":39,"length":18},{"style":"bold","offset":73,"length":18}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7vlbk","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5gpv8","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7a57t","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"73gqa","text":"For each haplome.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"a5beo","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"code_insert","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"19lnb","text":"pbmm2 index path/to/input/FC309v1.1.0.fasta path/to/out/fc309v1.1.0.mm","type":"unstyled"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"2h3lj","text":"","type":"unstyled"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"cmm8","text":"and ","type":"unstyled"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"6cp9s","text":"","type":"unstyled"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"56sh6","text":"pbmm2 index path/to/input/FC309v1.2.0.fasta path/to/out/fc309v1.2.0.mm","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"auivc","text":" After indexing, use FC309.isoseq.flnc.bam from step 2.4 as the input for pbmm2. Align this file to each of the newly scaffolded haplomes.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":21,"length":21}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"b29ok","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5sooc","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"a5lb4","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"1q4t1","text":"Where FC309.isoseq.v1.1.0_aligned.bam and FC309.isoseq.v1.2.0_aligned.bam will be input for GenSAS at step 7.6.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":5,"length":33},{"style":"bold","offset":42,"length":32}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"code_insert","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"e6gvr","text":"pbmm2 align path/to/index/fc309v1.1.0.mmi 309isoseq.flnc.bam /output/FC309.isoseq.v1.1.0_aligned.bam --preset ISOSEQ --sort","type":"unstyled"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"86rhd","text":"","type":"unstyled"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"1q0eo","text":"and ","type":"unstyled"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"3fp0p","text":"","type":"unstyled"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"cj5t3","text":"pbmm2 align path/to/index/fc309v1.2.0.mmi 309isoseq.flnc.bam /output/FC309.isoseq.v1.2.0_aligned.bam --preset ISOSEQ --sort","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"7s4pq","text":"Run isoseq3 collapse to collapse redundant isoforms using FC309.isoseq.v1.1.0_aligned.bam and FC309.isoseq.v1.2.0_aligned.bam as input. Output consists of unique isoforms in GFF format and secondary files containing information about the number of reads supporting each unique isoform.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":58,"length":32},{"style":"bold","offset":94,"length":32}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"bepr0","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ufot","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"4qdu4","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"bvj2b","text":"Where the output gff, FC309.isoseq.v1.1.0_align.collapse.fasta and FC309.isoseq.v1.2.0_align.collapse.fasta will be used in GenSAS step 7.9 for refinement with PASA in their respective project files.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":22,"length":41},{"style":"bold","offset":67,"length":41}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"code_insert","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"ch4h0","text":"isoseq3 collapse FC309.isoseq.v1.1.0_aligned.bam FC309.isoseq.v1.1.0_align.collapse.fastq --do-not-collapse-extra-5exons","type":"unstyled"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"87e5m","text":"","type":"unstyled"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"9n3il","text":"and ","type":"unstyled"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"2dnli","text":"","type":"unstyled"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"4ppue","text":"isoseq3 collapse FC309.isoseq.v1.2.0_aligned.bam FC309.isoseq.v1.2.0_align.collapse.fastq --do-not-collapse-extra-5exons","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"fs43i","text":"Under the \"Consensus\" tab, use the default weights for the two BLAST jobs, and the singular BRAKER job. Run EvidenceModeler.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6blt5","text":" ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"435ju","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"dj1eu","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"code_insert","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[{"length":17,"offset":0,"style":"italic"}],"key":"brtun","text":"Job Name (weight)","type":"unstyled"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"earsf","text":"","type":"unstyled"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"ebfce","text":"BRAKER: (1)","type":"unstyled"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"d0qpn","text":"BLAST nucleotide (blastn): (10)","type":"unstyled"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"123pg","text":"BLAST nucleotide (blastn)2: (10)","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"93mpd","text":"Under the \"OGS\" tab, run an option BUSCO job on the EvidenceModeler output. After the BUSCO job is complete, select the EvidenceModeler output and use that selected job as the OGS. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"3enpf","text":"Under the \"Refine\" tab, use FC309.isoseq.v1.1.0_align.collapse.fasta from step 6.2 and the EvidenceModeler job to refine the identified genes.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":27,"length":42}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"fhrh6","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5r67m","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"cqoii","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"7vmrs","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"code_insert","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[{"length":40,"offset":24,"style":"bold"}],"key":"1j686","text":"Transcripts FASTA file: FC309.isoseq.v1.1.0_align.collapse.fasta","type":"unstyled"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"f8jmp","text":"version : 2.4.1","type":"unstyled"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"20uol","text":"","type":"unstyled"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"8jd10","text":"Selected job : EvidenceModeler","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"cip1o","text":"Under the \"Functional\" step, run InterProScan and Pfam jobs to get functional gene annotations using the PASA refined gene set.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"10q0t","text":"Under the \"Publish\" step, check the box for all available jobs, and select filename options. When the publishing job is finished, download all files into a zipped folder for local and cloud backup. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"7ire5","text":"Your genome assembly and annotation is complete!","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
